data.title: Mouse wheel is not configurable shortcut key
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS X 10.11.6 Godot 2.1 Stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Mouse wheel is not configurable as a shortcut key. Current default behavior makes trackpad almost unuseable in godot.

data.title: i18n: Update list of supported locales based off glibc
data.body: Fixes #5733, fixes #6214.

data.title: Cleanup of the tools folder
Fix the support for WinRT/UWP
data.body:
~~**Note:** much of the commit history can be discarded, so this PR should likely be squashed on merge. I used commits to save work and I'm not the most linear person in the world, so work is scattered and quite hard to group. I'll leave it like this for now though, since it might be easier to pinpoint specific changes if need be.~~ Nevermind, I rebased the history already,
## Building
- I'm using Visual Studio Community 2015 Update 3. May or may not work with earlier versions. Please report if you find that it works or not with other versions.
- C++ tools for VS are needed of course, and also the Windows 10 SDK (all of which can be selected in the VS installer).
- Clone the default `ms-master` branch from the [Microsoft ANGLE fork](https://github.com/Microsoft/angle) somewhere.
- Set the `ANGLE_SRC_PATH` environment variable to the ANGLE clone full path.
- Same instructions as [Windows](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/compiling_for_windows.html): open the correct prompt (can also be the ARM prompt to build for devices). Run `scons p=winrt target=release_debug`.
  - This will also build ANGLE for the correct architecture, so no need to pre-build it.
### Templates

There's the `tools/dist/uwp_template` folder with the main template. Add the built `.exe` file here, rename it to `godot.winrt.exe` and Zip to a file called `winrt_%arch_%target`, where `%arch` is the architecture (`arm`, `x86` or `x64`) and `target` is either `release` or `debug`.

The template also need the built ANGLE DLLs. Copy `libEGL.dll` and `libGLESv2.dll` from `%ANGLE_SRC_PATH%\winrt\10\src\Release_%arch` (where `%arch` is `Win32`, `x64`, or `ARM`) to the root of the zip template.

As the other platforms, you need _all_ templates installed to be able to export. Those don't need to be correct, just to exist in the templates folder.

Note that the emulator only runs the `x86` architecture.
## Exporting

The exporter generate an **unsigned** `.appx` package. One important thing to change is the `Publisher` option in the export settings to match the certificate you'll use. Packages cannot be installed without being signed by a trusted certificate.
### Signing

There's code for generating the signature but the digests don't match. It was ported from [fb-util-for-appx](https://github.com/facebook/fb-util-for-appx) and I failed to see what is the difference. I left the code because it's almost working and I'm willing to revisit it in the future.

Hence, signing can only be done in Windows for now (note you don't need to sign beforehand when submitting to the store). Instructions for [making a certificate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/jj835832%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) and [signing a package](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/jj835835%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) are provided by Microsoft.
### Bundles

It's theoretically possible to make "App Bundles". Those are similar to "fat" binaries, i.e. they contain packages for multiple architectures. There's no code for that now, but it should be easy to do by refactoring the packager code.
## Third-party
### ANGLE

~~I added a module for [ANGLE](http://angleproject.org) since it's needed for UWP. Following the pattern already established in Godot to add the code and statically link instead of providing DLLs. Also, ANGLE may be used for Windows Desktop (which may solve some issues with problematic graphic cards) and maybe to EGL contexts like the Raspberry Pi.~~

No ANGLE module anymore. Now there's a dependency on external ANGLE source, as described in the "Building" section.
### OpenSSL

Microsoft have their own [fork of OpenSSL](https://github.com/Microsoft/openssl) to make it work for WinRT. Luckily the changes I ported are quite minimal and to make it easier I provided a patch file to see what was changed and apply it to updates.

From the MS fork I also took a file with shim code for unsupported API under UWP. This is only an _addition_ so it shouldn't cause problems.
### Enet

I also needed to apply a patch to make enet build. For this I did not store the patch file, but the changes were the same as [enet-uwp](https://github.com/ahrnbom/enet-uwp/commit/c14968f8f58cc96c5054e0c1a396701586582dbe). Those might even be pushed upstream, but AIUI enet is not really being maintained and not accepting PRs.
## Missing features

I don't see any important thing missing but I might have overlooked something. Nevertheless, here it's a list of things that wasn't ported because it's either too difficult or even impossible:
- Window mode (resizable/borderless).
- Maximizing/minimizing the window.
- Monitor info (amount/size). This _might_ be possible with DirectX though.
- <kbd>Alt</kbd> key and any combination is not reported. The <kbd>AltGr</kbd> is reported as <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Alt</kbd>.
- <kbd>F10</kbd> key is also not reported. Along with <kbd>Alt</kbd>, it's a System Key, which does not send events for the underlying window.
- Deploying and launching the app with one-click. 
  - The [Deployment namespace](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.management.deployment.aspx) has functionality to deployment, but I couldn't include the required header without getting a lot of redefinition errors.
  - Maybe it's possible to interface with prompt/PowerShell and use the commands to deploy and launch apps.
  - It's also pretty much impossible to detect the Windows 10 version without a manifest. Since the last trial for that failed for some people (#5364), it might be hard to make the feature version-wise (since you can't install UWP apps in earlier Windows versions).
## Extra tasks
- ANGLE can be integrated with Windows Desktop and maybe for other platforms too.
- XAudio2 audio driver might also be used for Windows Desktop (done in #6855).

data.title: mouse_enter signal doesn't fire if lmb is held down
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 21

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have two very expensive custom draw **control** nodes (inventory/stash) and while dragging (LMB is held down)  `mouse_enter` doesn't get fired.

Not sure if this is intended, but if it is, is there a way we can simulate the release of LMB internally?  If not, I guess my argument would be `mouse_enter` should fire even if the lmb is held down because well, technically, it's _over_ and _entering_ the area.. :)

data.title: print(5.0) shows no indication that the value is a float
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux X11; Debian Testing
Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

```
func _ready():
    print(5.0)
```

output:

```
5
```

expected output:

```
5.0
```

---

This also has knock-on consequences for producing misleading error messages, such as dict-lookup errors:

```
var data = {5: 'hello'}
print(data[5.0])

---
Invalid get index '5' (on base: 'Dictionary').
```

data.title: Singletons are not loaded when running script from command line
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1 & git

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When script is launched using `-s` command line options, it cannot access singletons (they are not loaded). Perhaps, sometimes this is desired behavior, but sometimes scripts do require globals, so it should be at least optional.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Launch script containing global singleton references from command line.

data.title: Int parsed as float when loading a dictionary from JSON.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 64b, Godot version fc70824 (probably any previous version as well)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Integers in a dictionary loaded from JSON are unusable to reference indices in arrays, apparently, despite looking like an int, sounding like an int, etcetera, it's not an integer. This is a very serious issue that can cause endless hard-to-spot bugs in games if not handled with utmost care.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I am loading some data from json files. That data contains some integers that are used to reference an index in a normal array. 
If done from a regular, gdscript dictionary, (such as `var mydict  = { value = 5 }` then I can do `print(myarray[mydict.value])` and as long as there's an index 5 in the array, that will work, no problem.

The problem comes if I acquire the same dictionary (with "`value = 5`") from json. Then it will fail. After spending some time debugging the issue, I came to the conclusion that the only way to get it to work is to "cast" the json-provided integer (like `print(myarray[int(mydict.value)])`). Meaning that, somehow, value doesn't contain an integer despite it having no decimal part in the json file.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Demonstration of this bug as-is: [Node.tscn.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/449041/Node.tscn.zip)
Demonstration that casting to int solves it: [Node2.tscn.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/449045/Node2.tscn.zip)

data.title: Templates build failure since fc70824
data.body:
Android and iOS builds are failing on Travis, i.e. the templates (`tools=no`) builds are broken:
https://travis-ci.org/godotengine/godot/jobs/156638801
https://travis-ci.org/godotengine/godot/jobs/156638802

For both, the error is:

```
modules/visual_script/visual_script.cpp: In member function 'virtual bool VisualScript::are_subnodes_edited() const':
modules/visual_script/visual_script.cpp:1124:23: error: 'const class VisualScriptNode' has no member named 'is_edited'
    if (F->get().node->is_edited()) {
                       ^
scons: *** [modules/visual_script/visual_script.android.debug.armv7.neon.o] Error 1
```

i.e. caused by https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/fc70824f7c6ab1944d54194f54b816e55671e177#diff-ca2cc3b4424c9b4e61a3d69f5ded492cR1124

Please fix.

data.title: Viewport as a child of canvas layer doesn't work as intended
data.body:
linux x86 godot 2.2 alpha 
Viewport, when in tree, works as a box that renders only things that are in bounds. When having viewport as a child of CanvasLayer node, viewport renders it's children even if they are out of bounds. 
Steps to reproduce: 
Tree: 
CanvasLayer
.- Control
.-- Viewport
.--- Sprite
Switch CanvasLayer to Node and viewport will work. 
Example project:   [Viewport Example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/448339/Viewport.Example.zip) https://www.dropbox.com/s/rcbs55gq6unet27/Viewport%20Example.zip?dl=0 (Thanks YeOldeDM :D )

This is my first PR in Godot. Hope it helps.

data.title: Range-based objects (eg: ProgressBar) do not emit changed signal
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Arch Linux - version 2.2.r5266.1b80eda

The part after last dot refers to the git hash you should be looking at.

**Issue description:**

I tried connecting a Range's `changed` signal, but that never fires. However, the `value_changed` signal fires just fine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Use a range node of any type
2. Connect a function to the `changed` signal
3. Set step, max, or min programmatically

**Link to minimal example project**:
https://github.com/ShadowKyogre/godot-tests_range-changed

**Relevant code in godot source code**:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/range.cpp

data.title: Nested function for VS (ability to group nodes)
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was thinking about this issue for long time. In general we can group VS nodes by creating new functions, but **I think it's not always practical to create artificial functions that have no other purpose than to 'group nodes' for some other parent function** (and bloat function list view with many helpers function this way).  This is why I would like to propose 'Nested Functions' for VS. What I'm proposing is ability to group nodes by creating nested functions. I will try to explain how I imagine this feature with gif:
![nestedvsfunc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/18139315/31dcde14-6fb1-11e6-8919-274a64b007de.gif)

I think this would allow us to have very readable VS scripts, and use them also in 'creating algorithm phase' where you could add couple empty blocks with nice names and implement them later when your 'high level logic' is on the place.

data.title: Fix release build. (II)
Calling _set() and using property assigning syntax is different
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
both 2.1 official & latest git tested

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
With custom `_set`, it's possible to set "non-existing" (not defined by var) values by directly calling `_set()`, but not using normal assigning (`a.b = c` or `a["b"] = c`). As i understand `_set`, it is supposed to be equivalent to using assigning operator (it is, in fact, called when using operator, but then error is thrown).

**Steps to reproduce:**
- implement custom _get & _set
- try _set with name that is not defined via var => works
- try = with the same name => doesn't work: after calling custom _set, fails with "Invalid index" error.

data.title: It's impossible to rearange functions in VS script
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It would be great if we could rearrange functions in Visual Script. Currently they are ordered alphabetically but I personally think we should be able to rearrange them. Imagine if you would be forced to put your functions alphabetically in regular text script. It's just not practical since quite often order of functions express some kind of hierarchy (one function use another one, some meant to be public other are helpers etc).

data.title: Editor crashes when trying to save scene with TextureProgress node
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Trying to save a scene while having a TextureProgress node in it crashes the editor. The debug window says:

> ERROR: Vector<class Variant>::operator []: Condition ' p_index<0 || p_index>=size() ' is true. returned: aux
> At: c:\projects\godot-builds\godot\core\vector.h:132

Tested it several times. It didn't happen once or twice out of about ten tries. 

It doesn't happen in the latest 2.2 alpha build. It also doesn't happen if I load a scene with the above elements from the 2.2 alpha build in the 2.1 stable and save it there. So it may be fixed already, but I found only #5599 about this bug, and that one got already fixed in 2.1. So i decided to report it anyway.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a new scene. Add a TextureProgress node as root node or as a child of a CanvasLayer. Save.

data.title: Add SRP (secure remote password) functionality to networking API
data.body:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Remote_Password_protocol

Adding such functionality gives a way to have authenticated peers (and/or encryption) without requiring use of a "~~trusted~~expensive third party" (certificate authority).  "The SRP protocol has a number of desirable properties: it allows a user to authenticate themselves to a server, it is resistant to dictionary attacks mounted by an eavesdropper, and it does not require a trusted third party. It effectively conveys a zero-knowledge password proof from the user to the server."

The key form of the protocol may be used to provide lightweight encryption once session is authenticated, useful to stop MITM (peer impersonation and packet injection) attacks.  MITM is of particular relevance to mobile games (two words: ~~airport/restaurant~~open wifi).

PS: If Godot embeds OpenSSL the article above mentions OpenSSL 1,0,1 and higher has SRP support.  Of the listed libraries providing SRP, at least one of them has Godot-compatible MIT license (The Legion of the Bouncy Castle).

data.title: Conditional GDScript parsing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Like we have preprocessor statements in C or other languages where we can notify the compiler that such and such code should be compiled if a condition is true or not (like am I compiling on Windows or Linux for example), it would be nice to have such conditional parsing in GDScript.

Since 2.1 we have in GDScript the nice function "type_exists(string)", which returns a boolean value if a given type exists or not in our Godot instance.

The problem is, I can't use this tool for anything other than checking just that.

If I'd put that method call in an IF statement, the code under true/false conditions is still parsed by Godot and obviously this will result in an error because I write something regarding a non-existent type.

Thankfully Godot can just ignore the script file in which I write such statements, but still I have to make special arrangements just for that (like keeping all my platform-specific or module-specific code in separate scripts).

This is of course just a single example use-case.

Or maybe there is a way to force conditional parsing of which I'm not aware of? I asked around on the IRC channels but got no answers in this regards, so I suppose that it's not possible to do such a thing currently.

data.title: Support more formats for project translations
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Currently, Godot editor uses gettext format (POT/PO/MO files) for it's localization, while Godot projects are supposed to utilize .csv format files.

I understand the pros of using spreadsheets for keeping string translations, but the format has it's issues too, like having to stay careful in regards to the tools you use for editing them (newer versions of Excel can seriously bloat a simple .csv file). One user has issue #5640 in regards to encoding and end-line chars.

I propose that Godot should support more formats for importing translations into projects, starting with gettext as it's pretty standard fare today and already supported by the Godot build process.
